title: How to Make Nigerian Styled Moi Moi (Bean Pudding)

steps.title: Prepare the beans.
steps.content: Prepare the beans. Tip the beans into medium bowl and fill with warm water. Soak beans in a bowl for about 20 to 45 minutes, until soft and skin is peeling.

steps.title: Remove skin.
steps.content: Remove skin. With your hands, begin to rub the beans together while submerged in water. As the skins of the beans float to the top, remove with the spoon strainer. Pour water and repeat until all skin is removed. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Blend the beans.
steps.content: Blend the beans. After all of the water has been drained out one final time, pour the softened beans into a blender, along with two cups of water. Begin to blend. Continue to blend until the beans turn into a smooth texture. Add more water if the mixture is not completely smooth. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Place the bean mixture into a large bowl.
steps.content: Place the bean mixture into a large bowl. Set aside for later use and mixing.

steps.title: Chop up the vegetables.
steps.content: Chop up the vegetables. Cut the red peppers, onion, and habanero peppers. The size of the cut vegetables does not matter, just as long as the pieces can be blended in a blender.

steps.title: Blend the vegetables.
steps.content: Blend the vegetables. Put the chopped vegetables and 1 1/2 cups of water into the blender/ Begin to blend until smooth. Crush the Maggi stock cubes into the blender and continue to blend with the vegetable mixture. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Pour the vegetable mixture into the bean mixture.
steps.content: Pour the vegetable mixture into the bean mixture. Mix both together and begin to add in the seasoned salt, salt and vegetable oil. Continue to mix well.

steps.title: Place the mixture aside.
steps.content: Place the mixture aside.

steps.title: Prepare a large pot.
steps.content: Prepare a large pot. Start by pouring 3 cups of water into the pot. Place on low heat to warm up slowly.

steps.title: Take one 12" x 10 3/4 aluminum foil sheet.
steps.content: Take one 12" x 10 3/4 aluminum foil sheet. Fold in half, hamburger style.

steps.title: Fold upward from the bottom.
steps.content: Fold upward from the bottom. Fold the ends about 1/4 of an inch 3 to 5 times.

steps.title: Fold the opening on the side.
steps.content: Fold the opening on the side. Fold either left or right, depending on which way you folded. Fold about a 1/4 inch for about 3 to 5 times.

steps.title: Set the aluminum foil pockets to one side.
steps.content: Set the aluminum foil pockets to one side. Repeat the steps above until you've produced 10 or more sheets. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Pour 1 cup of moi moi mixture into one aluminum pocket.
steps.content: Pour 1 cup of moi moi mixture into one aluminum pocket.

steps.title: Twist the opening closed.
steps.content: Twist the opening closed. With your index finger and your thumb, squeeze the opening closed and begin to twist (either clockwise or counterclockwise).

steps.title: Place each filled pocket into the pot.
steps.content: Place each filled pocket into the pot.

steps.title: Repeat the steps until there is no more mixture.
steps.content: Repeat the steps until there is no more mixture. Cover the large pot after all has been used. It's okay for the moi moi pockets to be stacked on top of each other as long as they are facing upward.

steps.title: Change the heat to medium-high heat.
steps.content: Change the heat to medium-high heat. Allow the moi moi packets to cook for about 45 minutes to an hour. Be sure to check back every 10 minutes. [5] X Research source

steps.title: After the recommended cooking time, allow for the pot to cool for a while.
steps.content: After the recommended cooking time, allow for the pot to cool for a while. Once cooled down to your preferred temperature, take one moi moi packet using an oven-mitt or tong utensil and place onto a plate.

steps.title: Remove the aluminum foil wrapping.
steps.content: Remove the aluminum foil wrapping. And the Moi Moi is ready to eat. Enjoy!

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished.
